intro: Physaria acutifolia var. stylosa, commonly known as the narrowleaf bluestem, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and linear, with a bluish-green hue, and it produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers in the summer. This variety is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along rocky slopes.
